did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Many issues of Low Rider Magazine (1977-1982, San Jose, California); two issues of Lowriders are Happening (volume 1, numbers 1 and 2, 1979); one issue of Lowrider Cruisin' (volume 1, number 1, August 1981). Also, Technical low rider, v. 1, no. 1 (1981); Low rider calendar (1980); program for the first national low rider show (1978); press release and publicity photo for the documentary Low 'n slow (1982); issues from Q-vo magazine, v. 1-3 (1979-1981); and Cholo, issue 2 and 3 (1980).

bioghist.p: Lowrider culture began in the Chicano (Mexican American) barrios of southern California, and spread from there throughout the United States. It centers around low-slung cars which have been customized and decorated as works of art.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Many issues of Low Rider Magazine (1977-1982, San Jose, California); two issues of Lowriders are Happening (volume 1, numbers 1 and 2, 1979); one issue of Lowrider Cruisin' (volume 1, number 1, August 1981). Also, Technical low rider, v. 1, no. 1 (1981); Low rider calendar (1980); program for the first national low rider show (1978); press release and publicity photo for the documentary Low 'n slow (1982); issues from Q-vo magazine, v. 1-3 (1979-1981); and Cholo, issue 2 and 3 (1980).

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Mexican Americans -- Social life and customs.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Lowrider Collection, #8098. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

odd.head: NOTES
odd.p: The serials Low rider, Q-vo, and Cholo are also cataloged separately.

did.unittitle: First national low rider show program

scopecontent.p: No. 1-5 + June-December issues (issues don't have numbers after #5)
